result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andrew Dean Davis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Andrew Dean Davis.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Defense requests an adjournment.  Court rescheduled hearing.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties. This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a. Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Letter from defendant re:  upcoming hearing on 9/1/22 being held via ZOOM.  (Andrew Davis - #603706, Dodge Correctional Institution, PO Box 700, Waupun WI 53963).
Letter from defendant re:  rescheduling upcoming hearing.  (Andrew Davis - #603706, Dodge Correctional Institution, PO Box 700, Waupun WI 53963).

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Andrew Dean Davis not in court, in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. CASE HELD VIA ZOOM. Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Defense requested Plea and Sentencing date. Court set date as requested. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andrew Dean Davis in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Andrew Dean Davis in custody.  BOTH APPEARED BY VIDEO.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Andrew Dean Davis not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Andrew Dean Davis in court with attorney Rosemary Cuevas.  Defendant Andrew Dean Davis in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Andrew Dean Davis appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
